results.content:
***I'm rating after watching the third video of this course! I may re-rate if Udemy asks.***

This course is what I want for Python/Django and React learning. My only criticism is the accent of the course instructor which maybe difficult to understand sometimes. It's not his fault, not a lot of people can use different accents anyway. 

Since I'm an intermediate Python programmer and Front-End developer this won't be a problem for me anyway since most likely I can figure it out, but I'm not sure about beginner-intermediate programmers however.

results.content: I really liked the course...very complete, well organized, Krystian the teacher solved me my questions quickly. Thanks!!!

results.content:
I tried several Django courses, but this one was the best.  It covers Django, Django REST Framework, and React, which is exactly the combination I needed.  

Krystian is an excellent teacher.  I have some previous programming knowledge, but Krystian showed me several helpful tips and tricks.  He is easy to understand and has some funny examples.  

I also like how he does some live debugging.  It shows that he really knows the material and how to fix things.  I really enjoyed this course and would definitely take another one from this instructor.
results.content_html:
I tried several Django courses, but this one was the best. It covers Django, Django REST Framework, and React, which is exactly the combination I needed.

Krystian is an excellent teacher. I have some previous programming knowledge, but Krystian showed me several helpful tips and tricks. He is easy to understand and has some funny examples.

I also like how he does some live debugging. It shows that he really knows the material and how to fix things. I really enjoyed this course and would definitely take another one from this instructor.

results.content: I have done many courses online, and I wasn't impressed with this one. I had to really try hard to stick through the entire course. I found he was very unorganized during the presentations, and obviously had not dry run any of them. Normally you can tell if an instructor has put the time in to make the presentations because they dry run everything, and know exactly what will happen as they code. Pointing out when errors will be coming up, instead this one was program by error. Not impressed.
results.content_html: I have done many courses online, and I wasn't impressed with this one. I had to really try hard to stick through the entire course. I found he was very unorganized during the presentations, and obviously had not dry run any of them. Normally you can tell if an instructor has put the time in to make the presentations because they dry run everything, and know exactly what will happen as they code. Pointing out when errors will be coming up, instead this one was program by error. Not impressed.

results.content: The instructor helped me get setup up with the tools and configurations to run a react native app, however he only demonstrates the bare minimum. The finished app, to me, doesn't seem finished with key features missing, such as logout and state management for the rating that dose not update. I also had to do a lot of bug fixing that the instructor forgot to explain or was outdated. Overall it was an OK learning experience. If you have experience coding you shouldn't have to much issues figuring it out, but If you are new to coding I suggest a different course.
results.content_html: The instructor helped me get setup up with the tools and configurations to run a react native app, however he only demonstrates the bare minimum. The finished app, to me, doesn't seem finished with key features missing, such as logout and state management for the rating that dose not update. If you have experience coding you shouldn't have to much issues figuring it out, but If you are new to coding I suggest a different course.

results.content: The concept of the course was really smart; one section for explanation and one section for use. I took this class only to see how Django can be combined with React/React Native. I've taken multiple Django classes and I can say this course has lack of explanation, thinking on feet and not very efficient way of writing code. Overall I don't regret it for spending my money and time; I still learned something. The instructor is very nice and he tries his best and the Q&A.
results.content_html: The concept of the course was really smart; one section for explanation and one section for use. I took this class only to see how Django can be combined with React/React Native. I've taken multiple Django classes and I can say this course has lack of explanation, thinking on feet and not very efficient way of writing code. Overall I don't regret it for spending my money and time; I still learned something. The instructor is very nice and he tries his best and the Q&A.

results.content: Very good course to serve as an introduction to React and React Native as Frontend frameworks and Django as a Backend one. They combine smoothly and the end result  serves its good purpose as a functional web/mobile app. The only thing I would add is how to handle errors while working on higher versions of some packages, like FontAwesome svg drawing on Android, which currently fails. Thanks, it was really useful!
results.content_html: Very good course to serve as an introduction to React and React Native as Frontend frameworks and Django as a Backend one. They combine smoothly and the end result serves its good purpose as a functional web/mobile app. The only thing I would add is how to handle errors while working on higher versions of some packages, like FontAwesome svg drawing on Android, which currently fails. Thanks, it was really useful!

results.content: Amazing course for an overview of full stack-technologies.
results.content_html: Amazing course for an overview of full stack-technologies.

A good overview targeting beginners in Django and React. A bit too slow at the beginning.
Also, I couldn't help not noticing a few ugly things the author was suggesting:
- there was no reusability of the existing ViewSet function for retrieving the instance (self.get_object());
- pulling all entries from DB to get the count instead of using the aggregate function COUNT, Model.objects.all().count(); -- it is a very very bad practice that might kill your app performance in a real-life situation;
- the same with the average: (self.ratings.all().aggregate(Avg("stars")));

Nevertheless, I suggest taking this course.

Thank you!

results.content:
The good: It's Information packed and without the fluff that people don't need or already know (like history or the basics of what a MWC framework is etc..)
The flow through the lectures is quite smooth.
The bad: Best practices, there are instances where best practices aren't followed and an ad-hoc solution is used instead. For instance the login uses a location.href redirect where react-router in actual use has it's own approach which would not take that much longer to explain (but hard to notice and correct on your own once you try to run your deployed demo)
results.content_html:
The good: It's Information packed and without the fluff that people don't need or already know (like history or the basics of what a MWC framework is etc..)
The flow through the lectures is quite smooth.
The bad: Best practices, there are instances where best practices aren't followed and an ad-hoc solution is used instead. For instance the login uses a location.href redirect where react-router in actual use has it's own approach which would not take that much longer to explain (but hard to notice and correct on your own once you try to run your deployed demo)

results.content_html: Really great course, I really needed help with react and I believe i achieved that

results.content:
Easy to follow, it's really for beginners, well sort of.

I suggest after learning the fundamentals of Python and Javascript, atleast make some quick research on  MVC  (model view controler )frameworks. Otherwise you may end up confused, because Django framework is kinda opinionated framework, good thing you will be coding less and it works like magic :). By the way, Django more on MVT (model view temple) the MVC. Django will takes care of the Controller part , and that's for me, its a lot easier and faster to work with.

P.S. :
By the time of this writing AsyncStorage that used in this tutorial are now depricated. I suggest use
react-native-encrypted-storage instead, but you need to use react-native cli instead expo cli. This is one of many reason why choose react-native cli over expo cli.

* For some linux (ubuntu) users: I had some run time issue with Oracle Java, try OpenJDK instead.
results.content_html:
Easy to follow, it's really for beginners, well sort of.

I suggest after learning the fundamentals of Python and Javascript, atleast make some quick research on MVC (model view controler )frameworks. Otherwise you may end up confused, because Django framework is kinda opinionated framework, good thing you will be coding less and it works like magic :). By the way, Django more on MVT (model view temple) the MVC. Django will takes care of the Controller part , and that's for me, its a lot easier and faster to work with.

P.S. :
By the time of this writing AsyncStorage that used in this tutorial are now depricated. I suggest use
react-native-encrypted-storage instead, but you need to use react-native cli instead expo cli. This is one of many reason why choose react-native cli over expo cli.

* For some linux (ubuntu) users: I had some run time issue with Oracle Java, try OpenJDK instead.

Lots of small mistakes done through the lectures, seems like it was not prepared properly. React explanations are a bit better, strange that Redux is not mentioned as a good tool for state management. Lots' of actions are performed without explanation: why it should be added or modified.

results.content:
The course is going on amazing!!
That's the first react course I wish I'd have had. The instructor more or less explains the react concepts to the point. My first react course was pretty detailed and long which in the hindsight I'd say got into details bit too much. On the contrary, this course covers what it is actually required to know to work with react. And later section, covers applying the learning with the project. To sum up this course is learn by doing in a quick time.

results.content: This course was better taught and included more practical knowledge on deploying a functional CRUD service than most of the "popular" Django tutorials that have been reviewed thousands of times. It's why I tried this less popular course as I wasn't satisfied with the more popular Django packages on Udemy. The section on React however gets a little messy. Making mistakes on the way is helpful to see how React breaks and to understand the logic, however I found myself feeling lost trying to follow and code at the same time. I think it would be better just to prepare a live coding session without the errors so as to show a one-time-through example of perfect code, then give examples of how it can break and why the demonstrated example works better. Overall, extremely well done and thank you very much, sir.
results.content_html: This course was better taught and included more practical knowledge on deploying a functional CRUD service than most of the "popular" Django tutorials that have been reviewed thousands of times. It's why I tried this less popular course as I wasn't satisfied with the more popular Django packages on Udemy. The section on React however gets a little messy. Making mistakes on the way is helpful to see how React breaks and to understand the logic, however I found myself feeling lost trying to follow and code at the same time. I think it would be better just to prepare a live coding session without the errors so as to show a one-time-through example of perfect code, then give examples of how it can break and why the demonstrated example works better. Overall, extremely well done and thank you very much, sir.

results.content: Likely would rate this higher if it was marked as an intermediate course, but the instructor moves way too fast, assumes you know a lot, and doesn't take the time to explain important concepts. Without prior experience with python, Django, React, and databases, there's a good chance you'll come out of this course feeling like you memorized the answer to a problem, without understanding how to actually solve it.
results.content_html: Likely would rate this higher if it was marked as an intermediate course, but the instructor moves way too fast, assumes you know a lot, and doesn't take the time to explain important concepts. Without prior experience with python, Django, React, and databases, there's a good chance you'll come out of this course feeling like you memorized the answer to a problem, without understanding how to actually solve it.

results.content: This was a good introductory course to building and deploying apps using React with Django. I believe the course was redone, so some of the components between sections were out of date with the rest of the course. Our front end was hard-coded to use the local Django server, however in the Deploy Apps section the instructor had different files and environment settings in place to change the URL to the production URL already.  There were a couple other areas that were out of date, but with a bit of extra work and searching online I was able to complete it, just a bit annoying.
results.content_html: This was a good introductory course to building and deploying apps using React with Django. I believe the course was redone, so some of the components between sections were out of date with the rest of the course. Our front end was hard-coded to use the local Django server, however in the Deploy Apps section the instructor had different files and environment settings in place to change the URL to the production URL already. There were a couple other areas that were out of date, but with a bit of extra work and searching online I was able to complete it, just a bit annoying.

results.content: Kinda got lost after a point, and it was hard for me to follow. Most of the explanations were pretty bad or non-existening (also "this is what we do" is not a reason), and there seemed to be too much back-and-forth rather than a linear progression. The structure of the overall course seems great, and you'll definitely learn stuff, but this one is definitely not for me.

Most of the explanations were pretty bad or non-existening (also "this is what we do" is not a reason), and there seemed to be too much back-and-forth rather than a linear progression. The structure of the overall course seems great, and you'll definitely learn stuff, but this one is definitely not for me.

results.content: I haven't left many ratings but as someone who already had experience with Python and machine learning as well as other coding languages, but never with web development, this was PERFECT. The course moved quickly but everything was touched on and the project portion really hammered home the information. I don't know if you can get this much information in a more efficient manner.
